imprimatur.translation[0].definitions[0]: approval of something, especially from an important person
His actions have the imprimatur of the Secretary of State.
imprimatur.translation[0].definitions[1]: official permission to print a book, given by the Roman Catholic Church
imprimatur.translation[1].definitions[0]: approval of something, given by an official authority or an important person
The campaign has the imprimatur of the President.
imprimatur.translation[1].definitions[1]: The work was published under the imprimatur of Goldman Sachs Investment Research.
